The leading actors of 1940s were Kishore Sahu, Jairaj, Pahari Sanyal, Pankaj Mullick, Bharat Bhushan, Ulhas, Ghulam Mohammad and Ashok Kumar while the leading actresses were Kanan Devi, Jamuna, Lalita Pawar, Noorjehan (who later migrated to Pakistan), Suraiya and Madhubala. The fifties brought onto the scene the famous trinity -- Dilip Kumar, Raj Kapoor and Dev Anand Ã¢â‚¬â€œ each of whom developed their own image and huge fan followings. The RK Films was launched in 1949-1950 with Barsaat. It was the same year when the Central Board of Film Censors was set up with Mr Justice Agarwal, the former Judge of the Patna High Court as its Chairman. 

NOSTALGIA 1947
- Vijay Bhatt's Ram Rajya (1943), A.R. Kardar's Shah Jahan(1946) and V.Shantaram's Dr. Kotnis ki Amar Kahani shown at Canadian National Exhibition in Totonto.
- Raj Kapoor came as the main lead in Neel Kamal, which was also the first film of Madhubala.
- Satyajit Ray, Chidananda Das Gupta and others started the Calcutta Film Society.
- Lata gave her first playback in Aap Ki Sewa Mein.

POPULAR FILMS OF 1947
- Shehnai : P L Santoshi - Rehana, Naser Khan
- Mirza Sahibaan : Amarnath - Noor Jahan, Trilok Kapoor
- Elaan : Mehboob - Surendra, Munnavar Sultana
- Saajan : Kishore Sahu - Ashok Kumar, Rehana
- Dard : Kardar - Suraiyya, Shyam, Munavvar Sultana
- Neel Kamal : Kidar Sharma - Raj Kapoor, Begum Para, Madhubala

POPULAR SONGS OF 1947
- Afsana Likh Rahi Hoon : Dard - Uma Devi
- O Duniya Ke Rehne Wala : Dil Ki Rani - Raj Kapoor
- Mera Sundar Sapna Beet Gaya : Do Bhai - Geeta Dutt
- Haath Seene Pe Jo Rakh Do : Mirza Sahibaan - Noor Jahan, G M Durrani
- Dilwaale,,Jal Jal Mar Jana : Naatak - Uma Devi
- Aana Meri Jaan Sunday Ke Sunday : Shehnai - Shamshad, Chitalkar

FIRST IN FILMS - THE EARLY YEARS
- Box Office Hit - Phalke's Lanka Dehan (1917) ran for 23 weeks in Bombay. It is on record that the money collected at the counters had to be transported in bullock carts with armed guards!
-Golden Jubilee Film - Prabhat's Sant Tukaram (Marathi-1936), directed by Damle and Fatehlal, ran for over a year
- Music Directors - Pirojshah Mistry and B Irani composed music for seven songs of first talkie film Alam Aara (1931
- First Playback - Maestro R C Boral introduced playback singing for the first time in the film Dhoop Chhaaon (1935). The song 'Main Khush Hona Chahun..' had an all women chorus led by Parul Ghosh with Suprova Sarkar and Harimati
- Woman Composer - Jaddan Bai, mother of Nargis, produced, directed and composed the music for Talash-e-Haq (1935). In the same year, Saraswati Devi scored the music for Bombay Talkies' film Jawani Ki Hawa.
- Songless Film - J B H Wadia's Naujawan (1937) did not have any songs as it was a fast paced thriller
-Most Roles As Police Inspector
Actor Jagdish Raj holds the world record of wearing the Police uniform in 144 films. He donned the inspecter's uniformfor the first time in CID (1952).
